subject: Re: MS Australia website - search function.

full_threads.body:
Hi Sophie,

Confirming we have updated the site search into popup.
https://www.msaustralia.org.au/

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Joel,

Thanks for making these changes. 😊

Can I please interject and reinstate the search function as a popup as it was before?

But still please keep the same functionality that you have addressed here from those other issues.

Would prefer a pop-up search on the original page instead of going to a search page.

Thanks,
Sophie

Confirming we have drafted the page Research Development coordinator.

Hi Petricia,

We have made some updates on the search. Instead of a popup you will now be redirected to the search page. 

We have configured the search parameters that will allow search on the projects we fund (More results are coming up when you search lechner-scott).

Regarding "Research Development coordinator". There is a redirect error which is now fixed. (We could also exclude this specific page. Let me know?)

Regarding the search result, it is showing the most relevant.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath


I have been reviewing the new MSA website, which is looking fabulous. Thank you so very much.


I have found a few bugs in the search function, if you could please look at and resolve.


When searching - a blue search banner is appearing - see below screengrab.





When searching it seems to be pulling old msra page content. i.e see screen grab below particularly the Research Development coordinator result. This is actually very very old content and should not be pulled. It should not even be listed, I do not even know how this is still here.
Additionally when you click on it you get an incorrect url (see below image)



https://www.www.msaustralia.org.au/our-people/our-team/


Additionally the search function also doesn't seem to be working correctly i.e. I search for a researcher lechner-scott and only receive these results. There should be so many more in particular her research project pages that we fund, her meet the researcher profile pages etc.




Please can you also advise in what priority order the search results are listing i.e most recent, most relevant or random??



Thank you
Trish
